0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	219	 A, full-length E1 protein was eluted with buffer containing imidazole and collected into 1-ml fractions.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	220	4% of each of the indicated column fractions was analyzed on a 10% SDS-PAGE along with aliquots corresponding to 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	221	0025% of the input nuclear extract, 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	222	0025% of the flow-through fraction, and 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	223	 The gel was stained with Coomassie Blue.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	224	 Sizes of molecular weight markers (MWM) are indicated to the left of the gel.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	225	 B, composite SDS-PAGE showing fraction 7 from the purification of each of the indicated mutant E1 proteins.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	226	 The sample for HPV6 E1 is taken from pooled peak fractions from multiple purifications.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	227	 C, SDS-PAGE analysis of E1-(72-649) elution profile.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	228	4% of each of the indicated column fractions was analyzed along with 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	229	003% of the input nuclear extract, 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	230	003% of the flow-through fraction, and 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	231	 D, composite SDS-PAGE showing the peak fraction eluted for each of the indicated mutant E1-(72-649) proteins.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	232	 E, purified wild type and Lys484 mutant E1 proteins (200 ng) were able to form a complex with E2 (10 ng) at the origin, as shown by a binding assay in which the complex of E1, E2, and 33P-labeled origin fragment was detected by binding to an anti-E1 antibody bound to protein A SPA beads (black).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	233	 Results of the same proteins in helicase (dark gray)/ATPase (light gray) assays show that the mutant preparations lack enzymatic activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	234	 Enzymatic assays were run at 37  degrees C using each E1 at 270 nM in a buffer containing 25 mM MES, 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	235	1 mM EDTA, and 10% glycerol at pH 7.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	236	0, with 1 mM ATP, 2 mM MgCl2, and 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	237	1 nM helicase substrate (nontailed substrate in Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	238	 After 2 h, separate samples were used for analysis of helicase and ATPase activities, using the SPA and colorimetric procedures described under "Experimental Procedures.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	239	" In the reaction with WT E1, 36% of the substrate was unwound, and 20% of the ATP was hydrolyzed.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	240	The purified HPV11 E1 mutant proteins were as active as WT E1 in binding cooperatively with E2 at the origin, indicating that they were folded properly.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	241	 However, they had no detectable helicase or ATPase activity (Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	242	 Collectively, these results demonstrate that E1 is responsible for the activity detected in WT E1 preparations.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	243	 Similar results were obtained for mutant HPV11 E1-(72-649) proteins (data not shown).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	244	 HPV6 E1 preparations were not validated in the same way; but given the complete lack of activity of HPV11 mutant proteins purified by the same procedure and the similarity of HPV6 E1 to HPV11 E1 in terms of sequence, behavior during purification, and enzymatic properties as reported below, it is very unlikely that contaminating proteins are responsible for the activity of HPV6 preparations.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	245	It has been reported that HPV11 E1 preparations obtained from nuclear extracts contain significant concentrations of contaminating DNA (42).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	246	 We used a sensitive assay with the fluorescent intercalating dye PicoGreen (51) to determine that our purified E1 contains only trace amounts of DNA, ~1 ng/ microg of protein (data not shown).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	247	Quaternary Structure of Purified HPV11 E1-(72-649)-- HPV11 E1 expressed in insect cells with a Glu-Glu epitope tag or in native form and purified by immunoaffinity has been shown previously to consist of a mixture of oligomers, with monomers or hexamers predominating, depending on the E1 concentration (14).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	248	 Similar results have been reported for BPV E1 expressed in insect cells (15), although in other studies BPV E1 has also been purified in essentially monomeric form from insect cells (44) or when expressed in bacteria (11, 15).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	249	 Preliminary investigations of the oligomeric state of our preparations of polyhistidine-tagged HPV11 E1 by analytical size exclusion chromatography suggested that the full-length protein was a mixture of hexamers and a much larger species, whereas E1-(72-649) existed in solution predominately as hexamers.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	250	 Further biophysical characterization was therefore focused on the more homogenous E1-(72-649).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	251	We have previously shown by chemical cross-linking experiments that HPV11 E1 produced by in vitro translation exists in solution predominately as monomers that form hexamers upon the addition of single-stranded DNA (20).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	252	 Similar cross-linking experiments performed with purified HPV11 E1-(72-649) revealed that it exists predominately or entirely as a hexamer in solution over a concentration range of 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	253	5  microM, even in the absence of ssDNA (Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	254	 These experiments were carried out in a buffer containing 500 mM NaCl, since high salt concentrations were found to reduce the tendency of E1 to aggregate at high concentration.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	255	View larger version (23K):    Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	256	   Chemical cross-linking and sedimentation velocity analysis demonstrate that purified HPV11 E1-(72-649) is isolated as a hexamer.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	257	 A, HPV11 E1-(72-649) samples ranging in concentration from 20 nM to 2.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	258	5  microM were cross-linked using bismaleimidohexane (BMH).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	259	 Denatured samples, at equal final concentration, were analyzed on a 3% Weber-Osborn gel (52) followed by silver staining.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	260	 At all concentrations, E1 existed predominantly as a hexamer.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	261	 At higher E1 concentrations, faint bands are visible that correspond to dimers, trimers, tetramers, and pentamers, possibly due to incomplete cross-linking.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	262	 B, sedimentation velocity results for HPV11 E1-(72-649).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	263	 Shown is a graph of s* versus dc/dt, showing both transformed data points and the theoretical best fit.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	264	 Data were obtained at 230 nm and 11  degrees C using a Beckman XL-A analytical ultracentrifuge.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	265	 The dc/dt data were analyzed using DCDT+ (54, 55) and fit well to a model assuming a single species with a sedimentation coefficient of 4.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	266	5 S) and diffusion coefficient of 1.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	267	04 Ficks, for an estimated mass of 355,000 Da.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	268	 The rms residual for the fit was 7.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	269	 The loading concentration was ~40  microg/ml (600 nM) or 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	270	Sedimentation velocity analytical ultracentrifugation was also performed to assess the oligomeric state of purified HPV E1-(72-649) (Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	271	 Data were well fit by a model assuming a single thermodynamic species with an estimated molecular mass of 355,000.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	272	 This is close to the value expected for a hexamer (399,000 kDa), but we cannot rule out the possibility that a low concentration of E1 monomers or other lower order species was also present in equilibrium with the hexamer.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	273	 Hence, the results from both cross-linking and sedimentation experiments demonstrate that purified E1-(72-649) is predominantly hexameric.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	274	Helicase and ATPase Activities of Purified E1 Proteins-- Characterization of the helicase activity of the purified E1 proteins was performed with DNA substrates made from short, 33P-radiolabeled oligonucleotides annealed to bacteriophage M13 single-stranded DNA.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	275	 Similar to reaction conditions in other reports, we found activity to be optimal at pH 7.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	276	 Low concentrations of bovine serum albumin were found to stimulate activity (data not shown) but were not used in the experiments reported here.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	277	 As illustrated for HPV11 E1, 200  microM ATP-Mg was sufficient for maximal unwinding.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	278	 The addition of excess magnesium did not have a significant effect on activity, except possibly at low levels of ATP (Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	279	 At these low ATP concentrations, we also found that a significant proportion of the ATP was consumed during the 90-min incubation (data not shown).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	280	 The linearity of unwinding and ATPase activities over time (to ~90 min for helicase and 120 min for ATPase) is illustrated in Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	281	 At the concentrations used in Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	282	 4, HPV6 and 11 E1 had similar helicase activity, while E1-(72-649), tested at a lower concentration, had approximately 5-fold greater specific activity (see also Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	283	 In contrast, the HPV11 proteins had similar ATPase activities, while HPV6 E1 was less active.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	284	View larger version (18K):    Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	285	   Basic characterization of HPV E1 enzymatic activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	286	 Except where noted, assays used 300  microM ATP, 1 mM MgOAc, and 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	287	05 nM Klenow-labeled partial duplex helicase substrate (described under "Experimental Procedures").
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	288	 Reactions were run for 90 min at 37  degrees C in HEPES buffer (20 mM, pH 7.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	289	 Reaction products were detected by gel electrophoresis (helicase) or a colorimetric assay using malachite green and ammonium molybdate (ATPase, see "Experimental Procedures").
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	290	 A, helicase activity of HPV11 E1 (25 nM) in the presence of increasing concentrations of ATP-Mg and a 0 (), 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	291	0 mM () excess of MgOAc over the ATP concentration.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	292	 B and C, time course for helicase (B) and ATPase (C) activities of HPV6 E1 (30 nM, ), HPV11 E1 (25 nM, ), and HPV11 E1-(72-649) (10 nM, ).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	293	 At each time, two aliquots were removed from each reaction mixture to measure both helicase and ATPase activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	294	 D, effect of M13 ssDNA on helicase or ATPase activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	295	 Shown are data for HPV11 E1 helicase () and ATPase () and E1-(72-649) helicase () and ATPase ().
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	296	 E1 concentrations were the same as for A.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	297	We found that M13 DNA could inhibit HPV11 helicase activity with an IC50 of 2  microg/ml or 7  microM nucleotides (Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	298	 Interestingly, however, very little inhibition was observed if M13 DNA was added shortly after mixing E1 with the substrate (data not shown), demonstrating that binding of hexameric E1 to circular single-stranded DNA is rapid and dissociation is slow.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	299	 Furthermore, M13 was found to be a much more potent inhibitor of E1-(72-649) than of wild type E1 (IC50 ~0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	300	2  microg/ml), suggesting that this truncated form of the enzyme may bind more tightly to ssDNA.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	301	We also examined the DNA substrate specificity of purified E1.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	302	 As shown previously for BPV E1 (44) and some other helicases (62, 63), unwinding is often more efficiently initiated on tailed substrates that possess a DNA fork, formed at the junction of dsDNA with noncomplementary single strands.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	303	 To test if this was the case for HPV E1, unwinding reactions were performed with the three substrates shown in Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	304	 HPV11 E1, HPV6 E1, and HPV11 E1-(72-649) did not show any significant preference for forked versus nonforked substrates.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	305	View larger version (33K):    Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	306	   Unwinding by HPV6 or 11 E1 is not stimulated by using a forked substrate.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	307	 E1 helicase reactions run using three substrates with different radiolabeled oligonucleotides annealed to the same region of M13, but containing either no tail, a 21-nucleotide 3'-tail, or an 18-nucleotide 5'-tail.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	308	 For each composite gel, lanes are shown for boiled substrate and reaction blank, followed by reactions with HPV6 E1, HPV11 E1, and then HPV11 E1-(72-649).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	309	 Unwinding percentages shown are values obtained relative to the boiled substrate, after subtraction of the blank value.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	310	 Reaction conditions were as described for Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	311	 4A except that the ATP concentration was 1 mM.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	312	Although we expect that an ATP-Mg complex is the natural substrate for E1, nucleotide hydrolysis and helicase activities could be observed for WT HPV11 E1 using eight natural nucleoside triphosphates (Table I).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	313	 CTP and dCTP were the poorest substrates tested but were still hydrolyzed at 20-30% the rate of ATP.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	314	 Manganese could be substituted for magnesium, but with approximately a 50% loss of activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	315	                              View this table:    Table I HPV E1 helicase and NTPase activity with the eight natural NTPs Reactions were run using 1 mM MgOAc and 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	316	3 mM each nucleoside triphosphate, except for two conditions using 1 mM MgCl2 or MnCl2 and 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	317	 The HPV11 E1 concentration was 25 nM in helicase reactions and 50 nM in NTPase reactions.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	318	 Products were detected by gel electrophoresis (helicase) or the colorimetric assay (NTPase; see "Experimental Procedures").
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	319	 Values reported are percentage activity relative to that for ATP-MgOAc (averaged 48% DNA substrate unwound and 140  microM ATP hydrolyzed) and are averages for three experiments  plus or minus  S.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	320	 4B, helicase activity was only slightly affected by decreasing the concentration of ATP from 1 to 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	321	 This suggested that the value of Km(ATP) might be significantly lower than 100  microM, in contrast to the much higher values reported previously (41, 42, 45, 49).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	322	 The colorimetric assay we used to initially characterize the ATPase activity of HPV6 and 11 E1 was not sensitive enough to measure ATP hydrolysis at low micromolar concentrations of ATP, so we turned to more sensitive assays using radiolabeled ATP.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	323	 Two different formats of this assay were used.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	324	 In one, the released radiolabeled phosphate was detected by thin layer chromatography, while in the other it was complexed with ammonium molybdate and selectively bound to scintillation proximity beads (see "Experimental Procedures").
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	325	 These two assays gave equivalent results, but we found the bead procedure more suitable for kinetic time courses, which require a large number of data points.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	326	 We determined values for Km(ATP) of 6 and 12  microM for HPV11 and HPV6 E1, respectively (Table II).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	327	 HPV6 E1 had consistently higher values for Km and lower values for kcat.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	328	 Similar values were obtained for HPV11 E1-(72-649).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	329	 We obtained similar values for the alternate nucleoside triphosphate substrates GTP, UTP, and dATP and also found that higher levels of free magnesium did not affect these kinetic parameters (data not shown).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	330	 Plots of observed rate versus substrate concentration were hyperbolic, suggesting that individual active sites of the E1 hexamer hydrolyze ATP independently (see Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	331	                              View this table:    Table II Kinetic parameters for E1 ATPase activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	332	View larger version (22K):    Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	333	   Binding of E2 inhibits E1 ATPase activity, and productive binding of ATP perturbs the interaction of E1 with E2.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	334	 A, ATPase reactions with 1 nM HPV11 E1 in the presence of other proteins.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	335	 Each protein was used at 1 nM (black), 10 nM (dark gray), 100 nM (light gray), or 1000 nM (white).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	336	 All values are shown relative to the activity in the absence of added protein (23  plus or minus  2% hydrolysis).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	337	 Reactions were run for 120 min at 23  degrees C using 1  microM ATP and 500  microM magnesium acetate.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	338	 B, plots of observed rate versus ATP concentration for HPV11 E1 in the absence () or presence () of 1  microM GST-TAD.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	339	 Reactions were carried out using 2 nM HPV11 E1 and the indicated concentration of ATP with sufficient magnesium acetate to give a constant excess of 500  microM.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	340	 Observed rates were determined from a time course as described under "Data Analysis" under "Experimental Procedures.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	341	" Lines represent the best fits to the Michaelis-Menten equation for this data set (Km(ATP) = 5.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	342	9  microM, or 49  plus or minus  9  microM in the presence of GST-TAD); parameters given in Table II are averages from multiple experiments.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	343	 C, E2-dependent E1-DNA binding.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	344	 Observed complex formation is shown, in cpm, between HPV11 E2 (2 nM) and different E1 proteins (each at 2 nM) in the presence of 0 mM (black), 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	345	3 mM (dark gray), or 3 mM (light gray) ATP-MgOAc.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	346	The ATP analog ATPS inhibited the ATPase activity of HPV11 E1 with an IC50 of 6  microM at 1  microM ATP, consistent with the value for Km(ATP) shown in Table II.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	347	 As anticipated, ATPS was a much weaker inhibitor of ATPase or helicase activity at 300  microM ATP (IC50 ~120  microM, data not shown), consistent with it binding in competition with ATP.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	348	 In other experiments using 1  microM ATP, we found that ADP inhibited HPV-11 E1 ATPase activity with an IC50 of 40  microM, whereas no inhibition was observed with 600  microM AMP (data not shown).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	349	For many helicases, ATPase activity is stimulated severalfold by ssDNA (62, 63), and for BPV E1 it has been shown that this stimulation correlates with the ability of ssDNA to stimulate E1 oligomerization (46).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	350	 The experiments we described above were done in the absence of ssDNA.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	351	 The addition of M13 ssDNA to HPV11 E1 or E1-(72-649) ATPase reactions containing 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	352	3 mM ATP had only a modest effect on activity (Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	353	Effect of the E2 Transactivation Domain on ATPase Activity-- The finding by others that ATP hydrolysis somehow promotes dissociation of BPV E1 and E2 at the origin (17) prompted us to examine whether complex formation between HPV E1 and E2 would in turn affect E1 ATPase activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	354	 To do so, a GST fusion of the HPV11 E2 transactivation domain (GST-TAD, amino acids 1-209), the portion of the protein that binds to E1 (19, 64-66), was purified after expression in E.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	355	 Titration of GST-TAD into ATPase assays using HPV11 E1 and 1  microM ATP resulted in inhibition at nanomolar concentrations (Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	356	 Inhibition was much weaker in reactions using 5 or 20  microM ATP, and GST-TAD had no effect on helicase assays performed at 300  microM ATP (data not shown).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	357	 Several control experiments were performed to verify the specificity of this inhibition.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	358	 GST had no effect on ATPase activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	359	 Most importantly, a GST-TAD protein containing the amino acid substitution E39A, known to weaken E1-E2 binding but not transactivation (67, 68), did not affect ATP hydrolysis.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	360	 As expected, the full-length E2 protein also inhibited ATPase activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	361	 In no case, however, did we observe complete inhibition of ATPase activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	362	 This lack of complete inhibition and the ATP concentration dependence that we observed on TAD inhibition suggested that the TAD-E1 complex might still possess ATPase activity, but with altered kinetic parameters.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	363	 In fact, we determined an apparent value for Km(ATP) in the presence of saturating (1  microM) HPV11 GST-TAD, which was 7-fold higher than the value obtained in the absence of GST-TAD, while the apparent value of kcat was not altered (Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	364	Since ATP binds more weakly to the E1-E2 TAD complex, it was expected that ATP-Mg would in turn weaken the interaction of E1 with E2 and affect their cooperative binding to the origin in vitro.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	365	 We in fact found this to be true (Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	366	 6C) for both HPV11 E1 and HPV11 E1-(72-649).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	367	 Inhibition by ATP-Mg was detected only at low concentrations of E1 and E2; at higher, saturating, concentrations, little effect was observed (data not shown).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	368	 Interestingly, ATP-Mg had no effect on the interaction of two catalytically inactive mutants of E1-(72-649) (Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	369	 6C), confirming that the observed effects were due to the productive binding of substrate.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	370	 We observed very similar results using ATPS (data not shown), which also affected the binding of full-length E1 or E1-(72-649) to a much greater degree than that of the two inactive mutants.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	371	Identification and Mutational Analysis of a Minimal ATPase Domain-- As part of our characterization of the ATPase activity of E1, we wished to identify the smallest domain of the protein that retains ATPase activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	372	 To achieve this, we made use of the fact that the ATPase activity of in vitro translated E1 protein can be assayed qualitatively following immunoprecipitation of the protein from a rabbit reticulocyte lysate (see "Experimental Procedures").
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	373	 By performing such an assay on a series of truncated HPV11 E1 proteins, we determined that the C-terminal half of E1, comprising amino acids 353-649, is necessary and sufficient for ATPase activity (Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	374	View larger version (19K):    Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	375	   ATPase activity of truncated E1 proteins made by in vitro translation.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	376	 A, the left side of the panel shows a diagram of the various N-terminally truncated HPV11 E1 proteins that were synthesized and 35S-labeled by coupled in vitro transcription/translation.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	377	 Proteins were immunoprecipitated with a polyclonal antibody directed against the C-terminal 14 amino acids of E1.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	378	 An autoradiogram of SDS-polyacrylamide gels, used to quantify the amount of each immunoprecipitated E1 protein, is shown on the right.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	379	 For each protein, the amount of ATPase activity was normalized to the amount of radiolabeled protein contained in the E1 immunoprecipitate (see "Experimental Procedures").
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	380	 The relative ATPase activity (in percent) of each truncated protein is indicated relative to that of E1-(1-649), which was set arbitrarily at 100%.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	381	 B, same as A but using C-terminally truncated E1 proteins containing a FLAG epitope (indicated by a hatched box).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	382	 Proteins were immunoprecipitated with the anti-FLAG monoclonal antibody.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	383	 ATPase activity was normalized relative to the amount of immunoprecipitated protein as for A and is indicated relative to that of FLAG-tagged E1-(72-649), which was set arbitrarily at 100%.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	384	As mentioned in the Introduction, this portion of the protein encompasses four highly conserved regions termed A, B, C, and D that are shared between E1 and the large T antigens of SV40 and other polyomaviruses (Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	385	 To confirm the importance of these regions for ATPase activity, mutant HPV11 E1-(72-649) proteins containing amino acid substitutions at highly conserved residues of region A and D and of the three conserved NTP-binding motifs were synthesized in vitro and tested for ATPase activity (Table III).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	386	 Amino acid substitutions in the NTP-binding domain, of lysine 484 in motif a (P-loop) or of the two aspartate residues at positions 522 and 523 in motif b, dramatically affected ATPase activity, as anticipated.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	387	 Another substitution in the P-loop, P479S, also reduced but did not completely abolish ATPase activity, in contrast to what was observed for E1 of BPV1 (41) and HPV6b (49), but in agreement with a previous report for full-length HPV11 E1 (42).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	388	 This result is also consistent with our earlier observation that the P479S substitution does not completely abolish the ability of HPV11 E1 to support transient HPV DNA replication in vivo (19).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	389	 Substitutions T566A and N568A in motif c also reduced ATPase activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	390	 Although the exact function of motif c is not yet clear, these results support its importance in ATPase activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	391	 Altogether, these results confirm the importance of motifs a, b, and c for ATPase activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	392	                              View this table:    Table III Effect of amino acid substitutions on HPV11 E1-(72-649) ATPase activity ATPase activity was measured as described under "Experimental Procedures" and in the legend of Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	393	 Activity of E1-(72-649) was set arbitrarily at 100%.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	394	 The amino acid sequence of each region or motif is indicated, with the substituted amino acids in boldface type.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	395	The ATPase activity of E1 also proved to be affected by some but not all amino acid substitutions in conserved region A, in the minimal E1 oligomerization region.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	396	 Three substitutions, Y380A, N389A, and F393A, severely hampered activity while two others, A390G and Q399A, reduced activity slightly.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	397	 Only the F378A mutant protein had activity comparable with that of wild type E1.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	398	 These substitutions and those in the NTP-binding motifs were shown to have at most a slight effect on the interaction of E1 with E2 (19, 20), and they also do not affect interaction with the p70 subunit of polymerase  primase,4 indicating that their deleterious effect on ATPase activity is not related to a dramatic change in the structure of E1.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	399	 Hence, these results support the notion that region A is needed for ATPase activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	400	 Similarly, the fact that one of the two region D substitutions, N609A, has a negative effect on ATPase activity is consistent with a role for this region in ATP-binding and/or hydrolysis, either directly or indirectly.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	401	Enzymatic Activities of the Purified E1 Minimal ATPase Domain-- To further characterize the enzymatic activities of the minimal E1 ATPase domain, we expressed it in insect cells as a polyhistidine fusion protein using a baculovirus expression system.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	402	 For validation purposes, two catalytically inactive mutant derivatives (K484A and K484R) were also expressed in parallel.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	403	 All three proteins were purified to near homogeneity (Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	404	 8A) by nickel affinity chromatography (see "Experimental Procedures").
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	405	 The purified wild type E1-(353-649) was found to be active in ATPase assays, with activity comparable with full-length E1 (Table II).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	406	 As expected, both mutant derivatives were inactive, confirming that the ATPase activity observed for the wild type E1 subdomain was not due to contaminating polypeptides.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	407	View larger version (24K):    Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	408	   Helicase and DNA binding activities of purified E1-(353-649).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	409	 A, purified E1-(353-649) and the analogous mutant proteins bearing the amino acid substitutions K484A and K484R were analyzed, along with purified E1-(72-649), on a 10% SDS-polyacrylamide gel stained with Coomassie Blue.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	410	 Sizes of molecular weight markers (MWM) are indicated to the right of the gel.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	411	 B, helicase activity of full-length HPV11 E1 ( x ), E1-(72-649) (), and E1-(353-649) (), under the conditions described in the legend to Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	412	 4 and as measured with the scintillation proximity assay described under "Experimental Procedures.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	413	" The K484A and K484R mutants had no detectable helicase activity under the same conditions.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	414	 C and D, complexes were formed between radiolabeled DNA and increasing amounts purified E1 proteins E1-(72-649) (), E1-(353-649) (), E1-(353-649) K484A (), or E1-(353-649)-K484R ().
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	415	 Complexes were then immunoprecipitated with an anti-E1 antibody.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	416	 C shows results with 840 pM (1.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	417	25 ng) of a single-stranded 60-mer oligonucleotide; D shows results with 68.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	418	25 ng) of a 370-base pair double-stranded DNA probe containing the minimal HPV11 origin of DNA replication.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	419	Given that the C-terminal domain of E1 has ATPase activity and that we previously showed that this domain is able to assemble into hexamers (20), we wished to determine if it was sufficient for helicase activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	420	 The purified C-terminal domain was indeed able to unwind M13-based substrates with efficiency similar to full-length HPV11 E1 or one-half that of E1-(72-649) (Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	421	 Improved activity was observed for E1-(353-649) relative to full-length E1 at higher enzyme concentrations, suggesting that preparations of this protein contain lower levels of residual nuclease activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	422	 As anticipated, the two ATPase-defective mutant proteins were also inactive (data not shown).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	423	 These results indicate that the two known enzymatic activities of E1, helicase and ATPase, are encoded within the C-terminal 297 amino acids.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	424	Binding of Purified E1 to Single-stranded and Double-stranded DNA-- The finding that E1-(353-649) is able to unwind partial duplex DNA substrates suggested that this domain of the protein is able to bind to single-stranded DNA.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	425	 This is of significance, since the ssDNA-binding domain of E1 has not been mapped previously.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	426	 To examine more directly the binding of E1-(353-649) to DNA, we measured its binding to radiolabeled ssDNA or dsDNA probes (Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	427	 In parallel, we also examined the DNA binding ability of E1-(72-649) and of the two mutant forms of E1-(353-649).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	428	 In these assays, E1-DNA complexes were immunoprecipitated using anti-E1 antibodies coupled to beads, and the amount of co-precipitated DNA was detected by scintillation counting (see "Experimental Procedures").
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	429	 All four purified proteins displayed similar ssDNA binding activity over the concentration range tested (Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	430	 These results suggest that the ssDNA binding activity of E1 is indeed associated with the C-terminal domain of the protein and is not affected by the two amino acid substitutions in the P-loop.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	431	 The C-terminal domain of E1 was also able to bind to dsDNA (Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	432	 8D), but in contrast to what was observed with ssDNA, it showed a 75% reduction in activity compared with that measured for E1-(72-649).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	433	 Hence, sequences located between amino acids 72 and 353 contribute to dsDNA binding, as anticipated from the fact that they are also needed for origin binding (see Introduction).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	434	 Collectively, these results suggest that the ssDNA-binding domain of E1 is distinct from the origin-binding domain.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	435	Since the C-terminal helicase domain of E1 is able to bind to both ss and dsDNA, we performed competition experiments to determine if their binding to E1 is mutually exclusive.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	436	 In these assays, ~4 ng (8 nM) of unlabeled 20-mer oligonucleotide or 30 ng (20 nM) of a longer 60-mer oligonucleotide were required to inhibit the binding of E1 to the ssDNA probe by 50% (data not shown).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	437	 In contrast, 1300 ng of double-stranded linearized plasmid DNA were necessary to achieve a similar percentage of inhibition, suggesting that E1-(353-649) binds preferentially to ssDNA over dsDNA and that it binds to both forms of DNA in a mutually exclusive manner.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	438	 Finally, competition by plasmid DNA was the same regardless of whether the plasmid had been linearized or cut into 23 different fragments, indicating that the weak binding of E1-(353-649) to dsDNAs does not occur through the ends of the dsDNA molecules (data not shown).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	439	     DISCUSSION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	440	E1 plays a key role in the replication of human papillomavirus; thus, understanding the activities of this protein is an important step in the search for improved antiviral therapies.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	441	 The expression and purification conditions outlined in this report have allowed us to produce sufficient quantities of full-length and truncated HPV E1 proteins to study ATP hydrolysis and nonspecific helicase activities in more detail.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	442	 Unlike the in vitro translated HPV E1 proteins we have used in previous studies, the protein expressed in baculovirus-infected insect cells is isolated as preformed hexamers rather than monomers.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	443	 These preformed HPV E1 hexamers could not be easily converted into monomers in vitro, similar to what was observed by Rocque et al.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	444	 (42) with their preparations of HPV11 E1 isolated from the cytosolic fraction of baculovirus-infected insect cells.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	445	 As a result, we have been unable to compare the enzymatic activities of monomeric and hexameric E1.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	446	 However, in the case of SV40 T antigen, direct comparison of the monomeric protein and the preformed hexamers indicated that these have equal ATPase activity and similar helicase activity on partial duplex DNA substrates.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	447	In agreement with earlier studies on BPV E1 (46) and SV40 T antigen (69), we observed that preformed HPV11 E1 hexamers have nonspecific helicase activity but are inactive in catalyzing cell-free viral DNA replication.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	448	 These results suggest that HPV11 E1, like BPV E1 and SV40 T antigen, must be isolated in monomeric form to be active in cell-free DNA replication assays.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	449	 In support of this suggestion, we observed previously that HPV11 E1 expressed as monomers by in vitro translation (25) is active in a cell-free DNA replication assay.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	450	 The oligomeric nature of our purified E1 is also most likely the reason why the ATPase and nonspecific helicase activities could not be stimulated by ssDNA or by a forked DNA substrate, respectively.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	451	 Indeed, previous studies of BPV E1 indicated that ssDNA enhances ATPase and helicase activity by promoting oligomerization of the monomeric protein rather than by affecting the activity of preformed oligomers (46).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	452	The unwinding activity of our HPV11 E1 preparations appears to be similar to that reported previously for BPV E1 and SV40 T antigen and more recently for HPV11 E1.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	453	 BPV E1 was reported to unwind 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	454	7 pM substrate/h/nM E1 monomer (5).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	455	 By comparison, SV40 T antigen was found in one study to unwind 3 pM substrate/h/nM enzyme (70), while in another a somewhat lower value of 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	456	 (69) reported values of either 1 or 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	457	6 pM/h/nM depending on whether assays were initiated with monomeric or hexameric protein, respectively.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	458	 4B, we calculated a comparable value of 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	459	3 pM/h/nM for purified HPV11 E1.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	460	 This rate of unwinding appears similar to that observed by Rocque et al.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	461	 (42) for their preparations of HPV11 E1, which they reported had approximately 4-fold less unwinding activity than T antigen.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	462	 The helicase activity we measured for E1-(72-649), ~1.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	463	6 pM/h/nM enzyme, is approximately 5-fold greater than that of wild type E1, despite the fact that both enzymes have similar ATPase activity (as shown in Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	464	 4C or by values of kcat and Km(ATP)).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	465	 The first 71 amino acids of E1 contain a high proportion of acidic residues, and removal of this region may account for the improved helicase activity as well as improved affinity of this truncated E1 for ssDNA (Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	466	 We found this truncated E1 to be less prone to aggregation, which may account in part for its improved activities.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	467	Our characterization of the NTPase activity of purified E1 revealed that eight different nucleoside and deoxynucleoside triphosphates could serve as substrates in NTP hydrolysis and helicase assays.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	468	 These results extend those reported by Rocque et al.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	469	 (42) and are consistent with our previous findings that the same NTPs are also able to stimulate E1-DNA binding and oligomerization (20).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	470	 We also found that ATPS and ADP (but not AMP), shown previously to stimulate E1-DNA binding and oligomerization, inhibit ATPase activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	471	 Collectively, these findings reinforce our earlier suggestion that the E1 catalytic site can accommodate a wide variety of substrates.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	472	 However, the reproducibly lower activity we obtained with CTP, dCTP, and TTP suggests that there are nevertheless some constraints on substrate binding.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	473	 Surprisingly, using both TLC and scintillation proximity procedures, we obtained much lower values for Km(ATP) or other nucleoside triphosphates than those reported previously for HPV E1 (230-380  microM) (42, 49) or BPV E1 (750-1100  microM) (41, 45).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	474	 A similar value of 600  microM was also reported for SV40 T antigen (72), but in a later report a much lower value of 4  microM was given (73).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	475	 This latter value is consistent with another finding that a fluorescent analog of ATP has a Kd of 0.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	476	4  microM (74) as well as the finding that, in the absence of DNA, T antigen monomers oligomerize at half-maximal efficiency upon the addition of 10  microM ATP (69).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	477	 Our values for E1 are more consistent with the value of 4  microM for T antigen.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	478	 Although it is difficult to explain these differences, it is possible that some of the previously reported values were not obtained under true initial velocity conditions.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	479	 Furthermore, in one report on BPV E1, Santucci et al.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	480	 (45) observed biphasic rate versus ATP curves, which they suggest could be due to a contaminating ATPase in their preparations.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	481	 It is also noteworthy that the value of 230  microM reported for HPV6 E1 was obtained from a preparation purified as an E1-E2 complex (49); the presence of E2 may have affected the reported value (see below).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	482	 (42) did report a turnover value for the HPV11 E1 ATPase reaction of 8 min1 with saturating ATP, quite similar to our value for kcat of 16 min1.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	483	We observed that the transactivation domain of E2, either in the context of full-length E2 or as a fusion with GST, had a significant effect on E1 ATPase activity at low ATP concentrations.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	484	 Even high concentrations of TAD had no effect at higher ATP concentrations despite the fact that E2 can still bind to E1 under these conditions (19).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	485	 In apparent contrast with our results, a previous study found that the presence of BPV E2 had no significant effect on the ATPase activity of BPV E1 over a wide range of ATP concentrations (45).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	486	 In that study, however, the activity of partially purified E1 was compared with that of a partially purified E1-E2 complex obtained by coinfection of insect cells with baculoviruses expressing both E1 and E2.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	487	 E2 was not titrated into the ATPase reaction, and it is not possible to estimate the percentage of E1 that remained associated with E2 under the assay conditions.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	488	 The inhibition we observed was specific, since neither GST alone nor GST-TAD with a change of Glu39 to Ala, which is known to weaken E1 binding (67), was inhibitory.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	489	GST-TAD appeared to modulate ATPase activity such that saturating concentrations of E2 increased the apparent value of Km (ATP) by 7-fold, while the value of kcat was unchanged.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	490	 A simple thermodynamic consequence is that saturating concentrations of ATP should weaken the binding of E2 to E1 to a similar degree (75), which we have provided evidence for using an E2-dependent E1-DNA binding assay, which requires interaction of E1 with E2.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	491	 In this assay, we observed inhibition only at low protein concentrations, consistent with the modest 7-fold decrease in affinity expected from ATPase experiments.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	492	 Binding of E2 to catalytically inactive E1 proteins was not significantly affected by ATP-Mg, suggesting that only productive substrate binding weakens the E1-E2 protein-protein interaction.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	493	 Since E2 affects ATP binding (Km) rather than hydrolysis (kcat), we would expect that ATP binding suffices to weaken the interaction of E1 with E2 (75), probably by inducing conformational changes in E1.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	494	 In virus-infected cells, where E2 is present at low concentrations but ATP is in large excess, this perturbation of E2 binding could promote efficient viral DNA replication, since previous work by us (25) and others (23, 24) has suggested that E2 must dissociate from E1 prior to association with the polymerase  primase.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	495	 Hence, saturation of E1 with ATP subsequent to E1 oligomerization may help release E1 from E2, and allow for its interaction with pol  primase.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	496	 It has been proposed that ATP hydrolysis is required for displacement of E2 from the origin concomitantly with the conversion of the initial E1-E2 origin complex into an enzymatically active multimeric E1-origin complex (17).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	497	 While our results suggest that ATP binding plays a direct role in weakening the E1-E2 interaction, displacement of E2 from DNA may in addition require ATP hydrolysis, for example to drive distortion and opening of the origin by E1 hexamers.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	498	 Additional work, ideally with purified monomeric E1, will be necessary to fully understand the sequence of binding and enzymatic events involved in the initiation of HPV DNA replication.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	499	We determined by deletion analysis that the C-terminal domain of E1 comprising amino acids 353-649 is necessary and sufficient for ATPase activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	500	 Shorter E1 fragments, which still retain the three ATPase motifs characteristic of superfamily 3 helicases (38), were inactive, indicating that sequences encompassing conserved regions A and D (Fig.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	501	 1) are also necessary for activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	502	 The requirement for these two conserved regions, and for the three NTP-binding motifs, was demonstrated by site-directed mutagenesis of highly conserved residues.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	503	 Region A is part of the minimal E1-E1 interaction domain, and the effect of region A substitutions on E1 ATPase activity remarkably paralleled their effect on oligomerization of the protein, which we reported previously (20).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	504	 The in vitro synthesized E1-(72-649) that was used in these ATPase assays (either WT or mutant sequences) was probably monomeric, based on previous chemical cross-linking studies (20), although we cannot rule out that some of the protein may have oligomerized under the assay conditions and/or during immunocapture of E1 on beads.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	505	 Further studies will be required to address this issue.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	506	 Nevertheless, our results point to a functional relationship between the minimal E1-E1 interaction domain and ATPase activity, perhaps underlying the fact that oligomerization enhances ATPase activity.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	507	Contrary to our expectation, we found that the minimal E1 ATPase domain (amino acids 353-649) is also sufficient for nonspecific helicase activity and for binding to ssDNA, despite the fact that it lacks the minimal origin-binding domain.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	508	 A recent report indicated that the analogous C-terminal domain of SV40 T antigen, also lacking the origin-binding domain, is sufficient for binding to ssDNA, probably as a hexamer (76).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	509	 It has not been determined if this domain of T antigen has enzymatic activity, but on the basis of our findings with E1, this seems a likely possibility.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	510	 Despite encoding all of the sequences needed for nonspecific helicase activity, the C-terminal domain of E1 made by in vitro translation is unable to support cell-free DNA replication (25), presumably because it lacks upstream sequences between amino acids 166 and 353 required for binding to double-stranded DNA.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	511	It has been suggested previously that during the initiation of viral DNA, replication E1 must first function as a sequence-specific DNA-binding protein, albeit of low sequence specificity, prior to assembling into enzymatically active hexamers (9, 16, 77, 78).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	512	 Our results suggest that these two activities of E1, sequence-specific DNA binding and helicase activity, require different domains of the protein, with the N-terminal half of E1 being required primarily to function as a dsDNA-binding protein and the C-terminal half being sufficient for unwinding.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	513	 One could speculate that these two main activities of E1 may have arisen from the fusion of two independent functional domains during the course of evolution.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	514	 A similar domain organization is also likely to apply to other origin-binding replicative helicases and in particular to the related large T antigens of SV40 and polyomaviruses.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	515	 Recent electron microscopic images of T antigen double hexamers bound at the SV40 origin have indeed revealed that this protein is composed of two structurally distinct domains corresponding to the origin-binding and C-terminal domains, respectively (79).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	516	More generally, we note that the 34-kDa C-terminal helicase domain of E1 is similar in size to the smallest naturally occurring hexameric helicase identified to date, the RepA protein (30 kDa) from the autonomously replicating RSF1010 plasmid (80).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	517	 Furthermore, enzymatically active C-terminal domains of similar size have been identified for both E.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	518	 coli DnaB (81-83) and phage T7 gene 4 protein (84), which are hexameric helicases in the same F4 family as RepA (85).
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	519	 Interestingly, these catalytic C-terminal domains possess the same organization as E1-(353-649), with an oligomerization region in the N-terminal portion followed by additional motifs required for ATPase and helicase activities.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	520	 This striking similarity between E1 and T antigen and these more distantly related helicases suggests that many hexameric replicative helicases may have a similar architecture, with a C-terminal domain of 30-40 kDa that is sufficient to support oligomerization around single-stranded DNA as well as ATP hydrolysis and DNA unwinding.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	521	We thank Lyne Lamarre for providing antibodies.
0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	522	 Craig Fenwick and Steve Mason for critical reading of the manuscript.

0.41806388.11304544.html.plaintext.txt	532	The abbreviations used are: PV, papillomavirus; ATPS, adenosine-5'-O-(3-thio)triphosphate; BPV, bovine papillomavirus; dsDNA, double-stranded DNA; DTT, dithiothreitol; GST, glutathione S-transferase; HPV, human papillomavirus; MES, 2-(N-morpholino)ethanesulfonic acid; PAGE, polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis; PCR, polymerase chain reaction; SPA, scintillation proximity assay; ssDNA, single-stranded DNA; TAD, E2 transactivation domain; WT, wild type; nt, nucleotide(s).
